Posts.Content: There is no way else to describe my current emotional state except PANIC! I have searched the internet looking for comfort in my numbers but it is just not there. My CAT Scan and Bone scan are next week so I don't know "for sure" that my cancer has spread but based on the biopsy, it looks bad. Has anyone got similar numbers and are willing to share their experience? I just want to know if I am really facing the Grim Reaper. My Urologist won't say anything until after the scans. Thanks for any response.
Posts.Signature: Age 71,Biopsy 06/29/208 RALP 8/27/18, post op path Stage T3b, gleason 9, invasion of Seminal Vesticles, Lymph nodes negative, margins positive 1.LAPEX, present in 2 out of 3 cores (2/3), involving 15 mm of 31 mm of tissue,47% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 2.LMID, present in 2 out of 2 cores (2/2), involving 16 mm of 31 mm of tissue,51% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 3.BASE, present in 3 out of multiple fragments and cores, involving 12 mm of 51 mm of tissue, 23% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 4.RAPEX, present in 2 out of 2 cores (2/2), involving 4 mm of 40 mm of tissue,10% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 5.RMID, present in 2 out of 2 cores(2/2), involving 13 mm of 36 mm of tissue,36% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 6.RBASE, present in 1 out of 2 cores (1/2), involving 5 mm of 40 mm of tissue,12% of tissue submitted Acute and chronic inflammation

Posts.Title: Am I a dead man walking? New member

Posts.Content: After waiting 16 excruciating days for the post op pathology to come back, I got the bad news above. Except I don't know how bad it really is . My doctor is recommending 2 years ADT and EBRT no matter what the 6 week PSA turns out to be. Even if it comes back 0.0, he wants to do the Adjunct therapies. I thought if the PSA comes back zero, I could wait on the EBRT and ADT. Now, I don't know what to think. I'm an old guy...just turned 72 and I don't want the radiation and ADT side effects chewing up my last few years. I have researched the heck out of it and I can't seem to find the 10+ year survival rates for my situation. The only other medical condition I have is Inflammatory Bowel Disease. I can only imagine the negative effects the EBRT will have on that. Do I have my head in the sand here? They found no cancer in the 4 abdominal Lymph Nodes or on Bone and CT scans. Am I being over treated? This is such a confounding disease and the doctors will not commit to anything. Color me CONFUSED? Any input appreciated.
Posts.Signature: Age 71,Biopsy 06/29/208 RALP 8/27/18, post op path Stage T3b, gleason 9, invasion of Seminal Vesticles, Lymph nodes negative, margins positive 1.LAPEX, present in 2 out of 3 cores (2/3), involving 15 mm of 31 mm of tissue,47% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 2.LMID, present in 2 out of 2 cores (2/2), involving 16 mm of 31 mm of tissue,51% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 3.BASE, present in 3 out of multiple fragments and cores, involving 12 mm of 51 mm of tissue, 23% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 4.RAPEX, present in 2 out of 2 cores (2/2), involving 4 mm of 40 mm of tissue,10% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 5.RMID, present in 2 out of 2 cores(2/2), involving 13 mm of 36 mm of tissue,36% of tissue submitted Perineural invasion 6.RBASE, present in 1 out of 2 cores (1/2), involving 5 mm of 40 mm of tissue,12% of tissue submitted Acute and chronic inflammation
Posts.Title: RALP Pathology Stage T3b, Gleason 9, Invasion of Seminal Vesticles. How bad is it?

Posts.Content: Thanks to all who have responded. I have edited my Signature to reflect that the margins and Lymph Nodes were negative. I have resigned myself to the EBRT and ADT. They are waiting for six weeks for me to heal from the RALP and then regardless what the PSA is, the additional treatments begin. If there is any good news about my condition, it is that I was continent from day 1 after catheter removal. The doc tells me that if I am continent before the EBRT, I should be continent afterwards. I am scrounging for nuggets of good news Again, thanks to all who responded. You pulled me off the bridge.
